maml:description.maml:para: List CDNs.
Fetches a predefined list of CDN providers. You can configure your MSL origin to include multiple CDN providers.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
An account switch key for use when you have access to multiple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Run `Get-AccountSwitchKey` to list the account switch keys available to you.

List CP codes.
Obtains CP codes based on the provided `-Type`. You need a CP code to create a stream.
The type of CP code. Specify `INGEST` to obtain the INGEST CP codes, `DELIVERY` for the delivery CP codes, and `STORAGE` for the storage CP codes.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
An account switch key for use when you have access to multiple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Run `Get-AccountSwitchKey` to list the account switch keys available to you.
When enabled, lists only CP codes that have not already been used to provision an origin.

When enabled, lists only CP codes that have not already been used to provision an origin.

Get a stream.
Retrieves detailed information about the requested stream.
An account switch key for use when you have access to multiple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Run `Get-AccountSwitchKey` to list the account switch keys available to you.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The page number to view, starting at `1`.
The number of data points that are displayed per page. The default is to display all data if you don't specify the page size.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Sorts the fields displayed based on the key that you specify, either `cpcode`, `createdDate`, `dvrWindowInMin`, `format`, `modifiedDate`, `name`, `originHostName`, `status`, or `zone`.
Sorts the streams list in ascending (`ASC`) or descending (`DESC`) order.

Create a CP code.
Creates a new MSL CP code. You need a CP code to create a stream or an origin.
A human-readable name for the CP code.
The ID of the contract associated with the CP code. Run `Get-Contract` from the `Akamai.Property` module to see these.

Generate a key.
Creates a new auth key, in either the `AKAMAI` or `THIRD_PARTY` formats.
The type of CP code. Specify `INGEST` to obtain the INGEST CP codes, `DELIVERY` for the delivery CP codes, and `STORAGE` for the storage CP codes.

Create a new origin.
Creates a Media Services live origin for the stream. You can associate this origin hostname with an Adaptive Media Delivery configuration.
> Note: Due to the complexity of the request body, it may be easier to retrieve an existing origin (should one exist), edit the details locally, and pipe to this function.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
An account switch key for use when you have access to multiple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Run `Get-AccountSwitchKey` to list the account switch keys available to you.

A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Create a stream.

Provisions a new stream. The process of creating or updating any stream changes its status to `PENDING`. When all of the steps are complete, the stream status changes to `PROVISIONED`. If any of the steps fail, the stream status changes to `FAILED`. It takes two to three hours to provision a stream.
> Note: Due to the complexity of the request body, it may be easier to retrieve an existing stream (if one exists), edit the details locally and pipe to this function.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
The stream to clone the internal settings from.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

Remove an origin.
Deletes the specified origin.

Remove a stream.
Deletes the specified stream.
If you delete an archived stream but don't include `-PurgeContent`, the stream will be permanently deleted, but any archived content saved on NetStorage will continue to incur billing.
If you set `-PurgeContent`, the stream will be permanently deleted and any archived content saved on NetStorage for this stream will also be deleted and can't be restored.
Your stream's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

An account switch key for use when you have access to multiple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Run `Get-AccountSwitchKey` to list the account switch keys available to you.
When enabled, deletes archived content on NetStorage.

Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
When enabled, deletes archived content on NetStorage.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Your stream's ID.
Update an origin.

Updates certain fields of the origin. You can also use this API to rotate keys. Populate the `previousKey` and `previousKeyExpiryDate` fields if you need your old keys to be valid for a certain amount of time even after rotating.
> Note: This function supports the pipeline, and can also read the `-OriginID` from the piped object.
Your origin's ID.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or string. This parameter supports pipelining.

Update a stream.
Modifies an existing stream. The request body object needs to be identical in structure to the `Get-Stream` response object.
You can edit the `name`, `ingestAccelerated`, `password`, `dvrWindow`, `allowedIps`, and `additionalEmailIds` members. If you try to edit any other member, the API returns a `400` error.
> Note: This function supports the pipeline, and can also read the `-StreamID` from the piped object.
Your stream's ID.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
